w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic weather words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for the weather
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: rain, snow, sunshine, hot, cold
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning and using words about the weather.
Circle the pictures that show different types of weather.
Read the question on the screen. Emphasize the word
by pointing at different pictures of weather.
Circle each picture one at a time and say
etc. Have students repeat each word after you.
There are many types of weather.
Answer a question about the weather today.
There are many types of weather
Circle the word, weather, and spell it. Have the child circle and spell the word.
Ask students to explain what type of weather it is outside where they are. Encourage student to use the sentence frame
Say the phrase, “It will rain today”
when you see a picture of rainy weather.
for students as you write it on the screen. Have students repeat your actions by saying and spelling the word.
Clear the screen and circle the word rain. Read the phrase
Visual cue: Show some printed pictures of
what rainy weather looks like. Encourage students to point to these visuals and say
Circle what you need when it rains
Read and underline each of the pictures, one at a time. (If possible, having props for each picture would be even better).
Ask students to circle each picture that they would have with or on them if it rained. Have students complete the sentence frames to answer in complete sentence:
If it rained, I would wear __________. If it rained, I would bring __________
Choose the correct adjective and say the phrase,

Circle the picture of the boy and girl in the rain. Ask for the correct adjective by using actions: one finger (hot), two fingers (cold), three fingers (wet). Encourage students to look at the pictures and repeat the actions again.
when you see a picture of sunny weather.
for students as you write it on the screen. Have students repeat your actions by saying and spelling the word.
Clear the screen and circle the word
Visual cue: Show some printed pictures of what sunny weather looks like. Encourage students to point to these visuals and say
Circle what you need for a sunny day
Read and underline each of the pictures, one at a time. (If possible, having props for each picture would be even better).
Ask students to circle each picture that they would have with or on them when it’s sunny. Have students complete the sentence frames to answer in complete sentence:
When it is sunny, I wear ______________.
Choose the correct adjective and say the phrase,

Circle the picture sun and thermometer. Ask for the correct adjective by using actions: one finger (hot), two fingers (cold), three fingers (wet). Encourage students to look at the pictures and repeat the actions again.
Have the child say the phrase,
Say the phrase, “It will snow today”
when you see a picture of snowy weather.
for students as you write it on the screen. Have students repeat your actions by saying and spelling the word.
Clear the screen and circle the word rain. Read the phrase
Visual cue: Show some printed pictures of
what rainy weather looks like. Encourage students to point to these visuals and say
Circle what you need in the snow
Read and underline each of the pictures, one at a time. (If possible, having props for each picture would be even better).
Ask students to circle each picture that they would have with or on them when it’s sunny. Have students complete the sentence frames to answer in complete sentence:
When it is snowing, I wear ______________.
to the phrase, “What color is snow?” and answer in a complete sentence.

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide 21
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
weather, rain, snow, sunshine, hot, and cold
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
weather, rain, snow, sunshine, hot, and cold)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity- Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
rain, snow, sunshine, weather, hot, cold
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
